resources.string: Fishy Illness
Defeat Gillgut in Piscarian Fishery for Constable Kemal in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"Is there anything I can do?"

I-I don't know. If you can find out what's causing this sickness and put a stop to it, you'd save our village from collapse.\n\nIt may be something to do with the fish in the fen. My son fell ill right after he returned with a large haul.
"Can you stop eating the fish?"

We're trying, but fish is our main staple in the Fen. The Piscarian Fishery may even be the source.\n\nIt's overrun by Gillgut Lost... perhaps try cleansing the place. It's worth a try... I'm sorry, please excuse me...
Defeat the Gillgut at {POITags}
Defeat Gillgut Lost
I don't know if it's the grief over the loss of my son or the illness itself, but I have never felt so bad.\n\nI don't think I'm going to make it.

You… you're back. It's done, isn't it? A few less of those foul Gillgut at the Fishery. Thank you.\n\nI hope it makes a difference, but of course, some who've eaten the fish are still fine. Who knows?
Troubled Waters
Defeat Ancient Guardians in South Vega Bridge and gather Ancient Herbs for Magistrate Allen in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"Is there any way I can help?"

Possibly. When I was new here, I heard old stories about an illness caused by the Fen itself.\n\nAfter two centuries, even my memory is hazy now, but I wonder if this same sickness has occurred before.
"Could that help identify a cure?"

That's the idea. If this is somehow a cyclical thing, it might have even occurred in the days of the Ancients.\n\nThere are herbs out by Vega Bridge they used for various ailments. Gather some, and Alchemist Rubis can test them.
Obtain herbs and defeat Guardians at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Guardians
Gather {itemName}
I feel like we're grasping at swamp reeds here, but we have to try something.\n\nAnything that can even treat the symptoms would be useful.

Yes, yes. These are the herbs I was thinking of. I'll have Alchemist Rubis look at them right away.\n\nI feel so guilty in all this. Kemal lost his son, and now he too is falling ill. Somehow, I seem to be immune.
Traitorous Wraith
Search for the ectoplasm trail northeast of the settlement to track down and destroy the Lost known as Mattheson the Trader. Then report back to Artificer Erasmus in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"What was stolen?"

Anything that wasn't nailed down. Food, supplies, tools - people are desperate to take what they can and run. \n\nThe strange thing, though, is that some of them have become Lost - and they're still stealing from us.
"The Lost are stealing from the village?"

Yes. One in particular -Mattheson - he was a trader here, always a greedy man, but not immoral.\n\nAs a Lost, he's come back repeatedly to steal from the settlement. If you can track him down and destroy him, it would be a blessing.
Track down Mattheson the Trader around {POITags}
Defeat Mattheson The Trader
Find the traitor Mattheson's trail
Follow the trail of Ectoplasm
Mattheson - I never fully trusted him, but I still don't think he would've been a thief when living.\n\nI just don't understand how he's maintained a sense of purpose as a Lost.
Then Mattheson has been dealt with? The traitorous bastard got what he deserved. Well done.\n\nI think he actually might have been the main culprit in all the thefts around town.
Swamp Sorceress
Investigate Gracewater Village and check on the wise-woman, Hazel. Then report back to Survivalist Severino in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"People living in the swamp?"

Yes. One of them was even a respected member of the community, long ago.\n\nHazel, the wise-woman of then Fen. A sorceress some say, she communed with the Lost. I haven't heard from her since the illness broke out.
"Should I check on her?"

If you don't mind, I think it would be a kindness. She lives out by the old Gracewater Village, in a cave near there.\n\nIf you can find her, try to convince her to come to the settlement, until the trouble is past, at least.
Search for Hazel at {POITags}
Defeat Hazel's Wraith
Hazel is a wisewoman of some renown here in Weaver's Fen. \n\nI haven't visited her in some time, but everyone has a story about Hazel appearing at the right time to help or heal them.
Wait… what? Hazel had fallen and become a wraith? I never would've dreamed. \n\nI suppose now she's one of those with whom she so often communed. Dear Hazel… you will be missed.
Hope from the Past
Defeat Ancient Guardians in North Vega Bridge searching for an Ancient Healer's Kit. Then report back to Magistrate Allen in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"Perhaps they had another treatment?"

That's what the Alchemist thinks. I hesitate to ask you to venture into the Ancient Ruins again.\n\nBut if you're willing, the Ancient Guardian Healers are on the north side of Vega Bridge. It would be a tremendous service.
"You think they have a cure?"
I don't know. The truth is that Alchemist Rubis thinks they simply have kits containing greater concentrations of those herbs.\n\nThis all a longshot, to be sure, but it's the only shot we have.
Search for an Ancient Healer's Kit among the Ancient Guardians of {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for an {ItemName}
If we didn’t have you and Alchemist Rubis, I might be making plans to pack up and leave myself at this point.
Ah, praise the Ancients! Did you get the kits? This is excellent!\n\nThe herbs you retrieved before are already showing some promise. These kits may help fully alleviate the symptoms. We'll see!
Payback
Defeat Fenwallow Lost in Taryville for Stolen Purses for Barkeep Flores in in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"What happened to them?"

Didn't run fast enough, I guess. The Lost got them out in Taryville, and now they're wandering around out there too. \n\nIn fact, if you'd help me try to get back the coin they stole, I'll reward you.
"That seems fair."
It's a deal then. Go on out to Taryville and see if you can find the dirty rats. \n\nProbably no different than any of the Fenwallow Lost now... except they'll be carrying my coin purses.
Reclaim Stolen Purses at {POITags}
Defeat Fenwallow Lost for {ItemName}s
Hope you're not the squeamish sort, because you'll need to search the bodies of the Fenwallow.\n\nNasty business, but that's my entire savings!
Well, look at that! My money! When I realized I had been robbed, I just about lost all hope.\n\nI know it seems petty to be so attached to some purses of coin, but I'd been saving for sixty years!
Refire the Forges
Gather Metalworking Supplies in Fisher's End. Then report back to Artificer Erasmus in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"Why are they harder to come by?"

Because we're in a swamp! We have plenty of oil, cloth fibers, and even fish, but metal is very precious here.\n\nThat's also why keeping these forges running is so critical - but now, we have no metalworking supplies.
"Where can we get more metalworking supplies?"

Hm. Actually, there's an old town called Fisher's End that used to be famous for their armors.\n\nIf you could go and get their Metalworking supplies, circumstances here might take a step toward being normal again.
Search {POITags} for metalworking supplies
Retrieve Blacksmith's Tongs
Collect Blacksmith's Bellows
Find Blacksmith's Hammer
More than anything, I wish we could reclaim the metalworking supplies that were stolen.\n\nThey're long-gone though. Fisher's End is our best hope.
Ah! These tools haven't seen use in years, but they'll have to do. \n\nGetting the forges up and running again is the top priority - for our iron supplies, and our sanity.
Vengeance for the Lost
Defeat Ancient Guardians in Canopus for Constable Kemal in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"You think he got it in the ruins?"

Ah, I don't know… honestly, these herbs Alchemist Rubis gave me were helping, but now I feel even worse.\n\nI don't care about my own welfare, just the others. Treatments aren't enough. We need to eliminate the source.
"And you think it's in the ruins?"

I only know what I saw. My son searched for relics often, and recently, he had been wounded.\n\nIf the Ancient Guardians are to blame, I want vengeance. Destroy as many as you can, and I'll give you my son's inheritance.
Defeat Ancient Guardians at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}s
Destroy those Ancient Guardians with extreme prejudice.\n\nIf I'm going to die, at least give me that much.

Ah, you did it - didn't you? Gave those Boney bastards a taste of their own medicine.\n\nThat's for son, and I appreciate that you would give a sick, old man some peace this way. Here, this is yours now.
The True Guardian
Gather chests for Incense in Aria Village for a ceremony to honor Hazel. Then report back to Survivalist Severino in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"Could Hazel's death have caused the illness?"
You mean, as if the swamp itself was reacting to her passing? I... I don't know.\n\nIt's certainly a tragedy for the Fen and for all of us, but once she's become a wraith, we can't bring her back.
"Can we somehow placate the Fen?"
Well, now that you say that... Hazel used to perform an incense ritual regularly.\n\nYes, it's worth a try. Search for incense at Aria Village, and then go back and burn it at Hazel's altar.
Honor Hazel at {POITags}
Defeat Fenwallow Ghouls
Gather Incense for the Ritual
Purify the Cursed Altar with the gathered incense
Hazel had a way of listening, whether it was to a person, one of the Lost, or even the Fen itself.\n\nI have a feeling this incense ritual might actually work.

You performed the incense ritual didn't you? I know you did - I could feel it. It was like a great tension was dissolved.\n\nBut you're not staying, are you? if the ritual needs to be performed regularly, who will do it?
"It'll have to be you."
Yes, it makes sense, doesn't it? I will have to pick up where Hazel left off.\n\nThe duty of keeping balance in the Fen now falls on me. Very well. So be it. Thank you, my friend, for everything.
Ghosts of Weaver's Past
Defeat Wraiths and Gather Chests for Music Compositions in Karburg for Constable Kemal in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"Is there any way I can help?"

You've honored my son's memory already, but this would be for me.\n\nLike you, my son was a person of many talents, a fisherman, a hunter, a scholar, and... a musician, a composer even. But his compositions were lost.
"What happened to them?"

It was the illness, of course. He was so sick... he knew he'd soon be Lost.\n\nTo avoid being a danger, he fled to Karburg and took his compositions with him. If you'll reclaim the compositions, it would bring me great peace.
Investigate at {POITags}
Defeat Geists
Collect {itemName} from chests
I think he went to Karburg because once upon a time, it was a bastion of culture here in the Fen.\n\nWe even lived there once, that was when his music was everything.

Did you find the compositions? Bless your soul, {playerName}. I can't express what this means to me. \n\nMy son's musical talent didn't come from my side, but if I survive, I will learn to play these.
Reprieve for Restless Shore
Speak to Innkeep Tomaso in Restless Shore to learn about the troubles there.
"What's happening there?"
All kinds of madness, from what I hear. Animals walking on two legs… factions within the Lost going to war with one another.\n\nDon't believe me? Go see for yourself - tell Innkeep Tomaso I sent you.
I'm telling you, from what I've heard about Restless Shore, makes me grateful to live in Weaver's Fen!
You've just arrived from Weaver's Fen, have you? I've heard that mysterious illness is getting better over there. \n\nSuppose that's good news, at least. Better than what we have going on here.
"I heard it's pretty weird."
Weird? We're well past that here in Restless Shore. I'm not the one to ask, though.\n\nTalk to Wilson, or even Muller out there. Let them be the ones to blow your mind.
Starting the Fire
Gather strange torches from Revenants in Karburg and bring them to Torchy Cabrera in Weaver's Fen.
"What is it that they say?"

Ah well, if you have not heard anything, then perhaps it is best we keep it that way.\n\nSuffice to say that I am no longer welcome in the Restless Shore settlement. It's really because of my research.
"Let me guess - you research fire?"

I do. I am on a quest to discover a way to create an 'ETERNAL FLAME'! Perhaps you would help me?\n\nSome of the the Lost in Karburg carry strange, long-burning torches. Get some of these for me, and I will reward you.
Look for the ones holding the torches. And try not to get burned too badly.
Oh, yes. Don't you see? The light, the color… it is truly beautiful. \n\nI will study these and see if I might discover how they burn so long and so bright.
Gather strange torches from Revenants in Karburg
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Burning from the Inside
Collect Perpetual Illumination Essences from Ancients at Aqua Acadia and bring them to Torchy Cabrera in Weaver's Fen.
"Depends. What's the favor?"
I believe the Ancients knew the secrets of eternal fire and eternal light as well.\n\nHave you ever noticed the perpetual glow that clings to the walking corpses of the Ancient Guardians?
"Now that you mention it, yes."

Indeed, they are imbued with some luminous magic, and in the ruins nearby, the bones glow even more than usual.\n\nYes. Aqua Acadia to the north. Gather some of the Guardians' essence, then we will know.
Amid the ruins of Aqua Acadia to the north, you will see for yourself.\n\nThe Guardians there glow more than anywhere else. Gather their essence, my friend.
Perfect… perfect! This illumination essence is the missing link!\n\nCombined with the substance in the torches from Karburg, I feel certain we have found the secret!
Collect Perpetual Illumination Essences from Aqua Acadia
Collect {itemName} from Ancient Guardian
Hellfire & Brimstone Oven
Travel to Navarro's Kitchen and defeat Chef Navarro and collect "Navarro's Flaming Duck Recipe". Then bring it to Torchy in Weaver's Fen.
"What do you mean by that?"
You must help me clear my name so I can go home. You see, I was exiled from the settlement for starting a fire...\n\nBut for once, it was NOT me who ignited the flame. I was framed, you see!
"Framed by whom?"

By that greedy bastard, Chef Navarro! He was trying out his new 'Flaming Duck' recipe and burned down half the settlement!\n\nHe became Corrupted, of course, but his 'Kitchen' is nearby. Defeat him and get that recipe as proof of his guilt!
Chef Navarro's Kitchen is not far, and I feel certain he still carries his 'Flaming Duck Recipe.'\n\nDefeat the bastard and get the recipe and I can finally clear my name.
He still had it, didn't he? Yes… yes! This proves that HE was the one who started the fire!\n\nThank you, my friend! I cannot thank you enough for helping me get back home.
"What about the 'eternal flame'?"
Oh, believe me! We will have that burning in no time! With everything you acquired and the black powder in my hovel, we will show them all a REAL FIRE!\n\nI mean... the good kind, of course.
Defeat Chef Navarro for "Navarro's Flaming Duck Recipe" at Navarro's Kitchen
Defeat {targetName} and Collect {itemName}
(Elite) Fenton's Fiend
Travel to Fenton's Hamlet, slay the Fenton Ravager, and bring back proof of its demise to Evelyn Van Heck in Weaver's Fen.
"I am afraid I haven’t.”

I expected as much. Blast.\n\nMy companions and I formed a band called The White Skulls. We hunt the many monsters of Aeternum in exchange for coin. We were chasing a bounty when my companions and I were slain.
“What killed you?”

A brute called the Fenton Ravager. It was easily twice my height and thick as a bull!\n\nI would not dare face it again alone, but there is a bounty to collect if someone were to bring back proof of its demise. Interested?
Just so we are clear, I am not responsible if the Ravager kills you as well. You take on this bounty at your own risk. I am content to wait here for my company to return.
No sign of the others yet, but at least that’s one less monster for this beleaguered fen to deal with.\n\nHere. Your bounty, as promised.
Slay the Fenton Ravager at Fenton's Hamlet
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
(Elite) Keeping the Faith
Travel to Periville and find Joan and Markus. Then report back to Evelyn Van Heck in Weaver's Fen.
“What do you think happened to them?”

The obvious. Or! They PROBABLY went on to our next bounty to get rich without me. That would be something Joan and Markus would do. It certainly wouldn’t be the first time, anyway.\n\nCall me soft, but…
“You still care about them.”

Getting covered in monster guts has a way of bringing people closer.\n\nOur next bounty would have sent us to Periville. Horrid, dangerous place. Send them to me, if you can. If you can’t… Proof of their fate will have to do.
Hope for the best, prepare for… well, I would rather not think about that.
I am at a loss for words, traveler.\n\nThis emblem defines us. Joan carved them herself.
Search for Joan and Markus in Periville
Search for Joan
Defeat Joan the Faithless and claim her {itemName}
Search for Markus
Defeat Markus the Penitent and claim his {itemName}
(Elite) Extreme Exorcism
Travel to Karburg, slay Ruiz Velazquez, and collect proof of his demise for Evelyn Van Heck in Weaver's Fen.
“Do you want me to find him, too?”
Yes. You have already risked so much. At least… finding Ruiz will be a little easier. I know where he would have arisen. It is sad, but at least there is comfort in certainty.
“Where can I find him?”

Karburg. It was the site of one of his most gruesome deaths. It haunted him. It haunted all of us.\n\nWithout hope, without a soul, only horror remains. Find him at the gallows, and bring me his band.
I hope I am wrong. I do not think I am, but where there is hope, there is also the potential for disappointment. Too much, and we lose ourselves. Just like they did.
Am I really the only one of my company left? Ruiz and I had such plans. So much we intended to do, together. Now he and the others have become the monsters we fought so hard to put down.
“Are you going to be alright?”

That is the question, isn’t it? They found their final death. I did not. I… need a drink.\n\nI will never forget what you did today. As far as I am concerned, you are a White Skull for life. Take care, stranger.
Return Ruiz Velazquez to his rest in Karburg
Defeat Ruiz Velazquez and claim his {itemName}
Gators Gone Wild
Collect alligator scales from Gators in Weaver's Fen and return them to Hunter Samuel in Weaver's Fen.
“What did you have in mind?”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: A hunt, of course! You and I shall venture forth into the marshes in pursuit of the most ferocious, cunning, and formidable beasts this festering land has to offer!\n\nJust as my forebears have done since time immemorial!
“I’m game. Where do we start?”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Aha! Excellent! To begin, we will make trophies of the largest predators these foul marshes have to offer!\n\nBring me the hides of any Gators you find in the Fen. Let the hunt begin!

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: I shall make my own way into the stinking bog.\n\nYou go on ahead. I suspect you will need the head start, after all.

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: You have returned! I was beginning to wonder. Now, let me see your trophies.\n\nYes… thick, unblemished, and as hard as anything. These are certifiably the remains of several fine beasts. Well done!
“So, do I win?”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Ah… well, you see, I was waylaid almost the moment you departed. A lone damsel walked the roads alone and I simply had to escort her to the hamlet. You understand.\n\nAll the same, I am TERRIBLY impressed.
Defeat Gators to Collect {itemName} in Weaver's Fen
No Mere Pigs
Collect boar tusks from Polder Boars in Weaver's Fen and return them to Hunter Samuel just south of the settlement.
“What are we hunting now?”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Boars! No ordinary boars, but boars the size of three men! We will not waste our skill on mere pigs!\n\nBring me the largest tusks you can find, and we shall compare trophies. They're a plague to this region!
I shall be along promptly!\n\nOnce I have finished oiling my musket, of course.

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: The prodigal hunter returns! You truly are a fellow after my own heart. Let us see your fine trophies. Hand them over, I say!
“You first.”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Ah! Naturally! Let me see… I had the tusks just here, in my satchel.\n\nIMPOSSIBLE! Look at this! Their sheer size and sharpness must have punctured a hole in my bag. Alas, I fear this contest is a draw once more!
Defeat Polder Boars to collect {itemName}s in Weaver's Fen
The True Contest
Collect wolf paws from Mallory Wolves, found north of Fenton's Hamlet, and return them to Hunter Samuel in Weaver's Fen.
“Does that mean I won?”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: How can you have won if there has been no contest? Nay, we shall have to settle this once and for all.
“I don’t know…”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Do you doubt me? ME?! Samuel Worthington Bloodgood THE THIRD?!\n\nNow this is a matter of honor. I demand satisfaction!
“That’s not—"

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: My word is my BOND, stranger. If I say I shall hunt, then I shall HUNT! Is it not my name, my legacy, my REPUTATION that demands that we finish this contest? Do you know nothing of honor?!
“Fine! What are ‘we’ hunting this time?”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Haha! You ARE a noble soul, after all. Let us hunt!\n\nTo the north you will find a pack of wolves known for their size and cunning. Claim their paws, and we shall compare to see who killed the greatest beast.
I relish the end of our contest. Go on. I am right behind you!

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: You are simply not going to believe this. My musket was ready, my boots laced, my satchel patched, and a COURIER found me on the road! There was urgent business in the hamlet to attend to.\n\nAlas, I must concede.
“Somehow I don’t believe you.”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: I understand, and I do not blame you. One excuse, understandable. Two! Difficult, but you gave me the benefit of your doubt. But this? Reprehensible.\n\nPlease accept this reward by way of apology.
Defeat Mallory Wolves to Collect {itemName}s in Weaver's Fen
Stalk of Shame
Defeat the Werna Packleader at Dusty Paw Burrow, far to the north and west of Weaver’s Fen Hamlet, and collect a trophy from your kill for Hunter Samuel in Weaver's Fen.
“I’m listening.”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Do you know what it is like, being saddled with a legacy like mine? Why, if people only knew how incompetent I really am, my family name would be utterly ruined.\n\nThat is why I need your help.
“I’m invested, at this point.”

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: The hamlet here demanded my aid. A large white wolf called Werna and her pack have been wreaking havoc on travelers wandering the northern roads.\n\nIf you can kill her and bring me proof, I shall give you the bounty.

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: I will not pretend that this arrangement pleases me, my friend, but I am grateful that you have chosen to take pity on me.

string.speaker: Hunter Samuel Worthington Bloodgood III - Weaver's Fen
string.name: SamuelBloodgood

resources.string: Ah, well, there it is. She was enormous, wasn’t she? I wish I could have seen it myself.\n\nAs promised, here is your bounty. And a tip. Your… continuing discretion is appreciated.
Track down the Werna Packleader at Dusty Paw Burrow
Defeat the Werna Packleader to Collect {itemName}
Story of the Stones
Gather stone samples from rubble in the nearby ruins. Then report back to Architect Na Li in Weaver's Fen.
"Really old, probably?"

Yes, exactly! These stones have been here as long as anyone can remember. If we can learn how the Ancient architects reinforced these structures, imagine what WE could accomplish!\n\nSo, I have a theory!
"What's your theory?"
If my assessment is correct, this bridge is over ten THOUSAND years old! I simply must get my hands on some samples to prove it.\n\nCould you help me with that?
Do you have those stone samples for me? They are vital to my research.
Look at this beautiful basalt you’ve brought me. I wonder where the Ancients sourced it from?\n\nNow, let’s see about that aging… huh. Wait…that can’t be right.
Gather {itemName} from Rubble
Spanning the Ages
Gather stone samples from rubble at South Vega Bridge. Then report back to Architect Na Li in Weaver's Fen.
"How old, exactly?"

I need another sample from a newer site to be certain. Master Ting Long once theorized that the bridge that spans the marshes was built in a more recent era.\n\nCan you bring me samples from South Vega Bridge for comparison?
I hope to have answers for us soon, my friend. And if I am right, then we might see some NEW wonders in Aeternum.
Great, you’re back. Let’s take a look at these new samples you've found.\n\nInteresting… these are less weathered, but only just. Fascinating.
Gather stone samples from South Vega Bridge
Gather {itemName} from Rubble
Deep Time
Gather stone samples from rubble at Andrometus. Then report back to Architect Na Li in Weaver's Fen.
"Wouldn't that mean the Ancients are also that old?”

It does, doesn’t it? So many questions, but we must resist the temptation to draw conclusions. Stone dating is far from an established field of study, after all.\n\nRegardless, I am looking toward the future, today.
"You want to build something that will last.”

Yes. I do. While I respect Master Ting Long’s work, I can see beyond it.\n\nThere is one structure here that predates all the others, according to my mentor’s study. Can you visit Andrometus and collect samples for me there?
Let me know when you've got those Andrometus samples. I have some theories about how they accomplished these feats of longevity, but I never draw conclusions without proof.

You and I will be friends, after this. Perhaps I will carve your name into the aqueducts of the future. Or would you prefer a temple? Maybe a stone garden?\n\nI am certain I can extract their secrets, thanks to you.
“How old was that last sample?”

Old. Impossibly old. Old enough that I am questioning my methods, but since you asked… somewhere in the realm of twelve million years.\n\nInsanity, I know. Perhaps I will send you a letter when I can confirm my findings.
Gather stone samples from Andrometus
Gather {itemName} from Rubble
That Beautiful Stench
Gather materials in Weaver's Fen and then visit an arcane repository to craft a perfume for Tullius Volusus in Weaver's Fen.
"It smells like a swamp."
Yes, precisely! That scent, it is primal, inescapable. It reaches down through your nose, through your lungs, into your very soul. With every breath, it commands, "Be awake! Be alive!”
"It is certainly hard to ignore."

So? How much of life you miss, if you seek only inoffensive things.\n\nPlease, I must capture this fragrance. Bring me the aromas of the Fen, brew them and bottle them, and I’ll reward you handsomely, hmm?
Can the unique fragrance of Weaver’s Fen truly be replicated by human hands? I await your return with bated breath.

Hmm, yes…decadent, musky, with a sulfuric accord that resonates right through to the top notes…you’ve captured Weaver's Fen perfectly. \n\nYou may be a genius, my friend! Ah, my eyes are watering with emotion!
"The aroma is… surprising!”

Is it so shocking? Hah! If only the ladies of New Corsica knew what they daubed upon their wrists.\n\nThe art of perfume is like life: The whole is larger than the sum of its parts. Thank you for your contributions.
Take {itemName}
Gather {itemName} from Bumbleblossom in northern Weaver’s Fen
Gather {itemName} from stags in northern Weaver’s Fen
Gather {itemName} from chests in Fenton Hamlet
Use the Arcane Repository
Craft {itemName} at the Arcane Repository
Misplaced Treasure
Search chests at North Vega Bridge for a clue to Nora’s whereabouts. Then report back to Leonie Roggeveen in Weaver's Fen.
“{playerName}. Pleased to meet you.”

Likewise. I was wondering if you might be able to help me?\n\nYou see, Nora and I like to play a little game to pass the time. She hides herself and leaves clues for me to find amongst the relics. Brain teasers, and the like.
"Do you need help with a clue?”

Yes! But not how you imagine.\n\nI was looking for her latest clue at North Vega bridge when something awoke the Guardians. I don’t fight. Could you find the clue and bring it back to me? Check inside the coffers and chests.
This game was much less stressful when it took place in EMPTY ruins, you see. I do hope she is alright.
You’re back! And in one piece! Do you have the clue? It could be a coin, a note, an etching…\n\nOh, give it here. The suspense is killing me.
"I found this coin."
A coin!! Oh, I just love solving her puzzles. Though it is markedly less stressful when she is not potentially hurt or in danger. All the same… let’s see what the coin has to say…
Search chests at North Vega Bridge for a clue to Nora’s whereabouts
Search chests for Nora’s clue
Following Nora
Search chests at Canopus for a clue to Nora’s whereabouts. Then report back to Leonie Roggeveen in Weaver's Fen.
"What’s strange?”

Something about the iconography she used… It suggests half of a whole. Aha!\n\nShe means to have me combine two clues to find her, but this tells me the second clue is at Canopus. Very clever. Care to help again?
As thrilled as I am, her long absence is truly starting to wear on me. Could you hurry with that clue? It would put me at ease to finally find her.
Another coin! Hand it over, let’s see what she has to say…
Search chests at Canopus for a clue to Nora’s whereabouts
Search chests for Nora’s clue
Odds in Her Favor
Follow Nora's trail to Aqua Acadia and search chests for the final clue.
"Nice job."
Nora thought she could stump me, did she? Me, the greatest coin collector in Aeternum? Come on, give me a tough one, haha!
"Seems like you have this figured out."

I do! But Nora might be dead. That makes this less fun.\n\nAqua Acadia is crawling with some truly nasty Ancient Guardians. Last time we were there, we had an armed guard of twenty soldiers…but you’re super strong, right?
Hopefully we near the end of our chase, my friend. Nora can handle herself… right?
I see you found my note. Did Dr. Leonie send you?
"I'm {playerName}. Are you Nora?"
Yes, I'm Leonie's wife! I am so pleased she solved it. Thank goodness she had the sense to send someone like you, though, these Ancient Guardians are not ordinarily part of our game.
Follow Nora's trail to Aqua Acadia
Search chests for the final clue
Nora, Found
Return to Dr. Leonie Roggeveen in Weaver's Fen.
"She seems a little stressed, yes.”
Yeah, no wonder. When those Guardians appeared, the only two things I could think about were "I'm going to die" and "Leonie will be so worried".
"So you’ve been stuck here?"

I was, fortunately, already well in hiding when the Guardians started swarming the place. Thank goodness you came along! I was starting to get hungry.\n\nAnyway, let’s head back. I’m eager to see Leonie after this.
I'll meet you and Leonie back on the road. I'll sneak out while you're distracting them.

You’re back! Nora told me everything. I am SO relieved.\n\nI’m going to have a talk with her about taking some precautions next time. But this was a fine game, and you were an enormous help. Thank you!
Protective Wyrd
Recover the components and recipes needed to assemble the armor Protective Wyrd. Then report back to Survivalist Severino in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"You honor her well."
There is always more we could do, which is why I have a gift for you.\n\nHazel once spoke of a set of armor said to keep its wearer protected against the worst sort of fates.
"Protected against fate?"

So it is said. Hazel claimed it was worn by a great healer, a sorceress like herself.\n\nDespite its lightweight material, the armor never failed, and the sorceress traveled all over Aeternum with nary a scratch.
"Sounds too good to be true."

We need such stories to get us through the dark times. But even so, Hazel assured me it was true and handed me this pattern.\n\nIt is called the Protective Wyrd. Collect these materials, and you can wear such gear yourself.
Nothing is truly lost on Aeternum, or so I tell myself.\n\nWhen the time is right, you will find what you need to craft the Protective Wyrd, I know you will.
There's something about you... Oh! You found everything you needed!\n\nThis is the most impressive attire I've ever laid eyes on. I can feel the power of the Protective Wyrd from here.
"You can?"
It warms my heart to know that the stories Hazel told me have not only proven true, but useful.\n\nIf her other stories are true as well, there may be hope yet for us all.
Complete Quest: Step in the Right Direction
Complete Quest: Wrapped in Wards
Complete Quest: Predestined Perils
Complete Quest: Within Fate's Grasp
Complete Quest: Facing Destiny

Facing Destiny

Handed the recipe.

Spores For a Cure
Collect Spriggan Spores in Eradinus Caverns for Magistrate Allen in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"Any new leads?"

As a matter of fact, there is. Though it requires someone to venture into the Eradinus Caverns.\n\nTo enter that infernal maw of botanical madness, well, it's something I would normally never ask of any living soul.
"But you'll make an exception?"

Only because you've proven so capable. In Eradinus, there is a mighty Spriggan - Teceros - a behemoth of earth come to life. \n\nIf mixed properly with our Ancient Herbs, Teceros's spores will cure the people of Weaver's Fen for good.
Alchemist Rubis assures me that Teceros's Spores will be the final cure we've been seeking. \n\nYou have already helped us a great deal, but this will truly save our village.
The spores of the behemoth? Very… disquieting, but I'll give them to Alchemist Rubis.\n\nTHank you, {playerName}. We finally have our cure, and you can have this prize as your reward.
Tracking the Huntress

Acquire Ancient Wood from Rafflesia, Wyrdwood Resin from Verdant Ascent, Hawk Feather from Propus, and a Lucky Rabbit's Foot from Echowhine Hollow to craft the bow known as "The Huntress." Then report back to Barkeep Flores in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"I'd be interested in that."

Wouldn't you, though? It'll be up to you to do all the leg work.\n\nIf you can collect all the materials on the list, I think this bow - "the Huntress" - will be the envy of everyone in town. Good luck!
Ah, still tracking down the Huntress, are you?\n\nIt'll take some time, I reckon.

Look at you - fresh in from the wilds and now a legendary tracker, at least to my mind. Finding all the materials can't have been easy. \n\nBut the Huntress - she'll take good care of you. Keep your quiver full out there.
Falmea's Wrath

Acquire Singed Branches from Amphus, Wyrdwood Ashes from Fornax, Unhallowed Water from Neptune's Fury, and the Heart of All Flame from New Balefire to craft the Fire Staff called "Falmea's Wrath." Then report back to Artificer Erasmus in the Weaver's Fen Settlement.
"I certainly would."

Perfect. I've been working on a schematic for some time - I call it "Falmea's Wrath."\n\nIf you can acquire all the necessary elements, this will staff will make you a true master of the flame. Good luck.
Still hunting for the elements to make "Falmea's Wrath"?\n\nKeep at it - I think you'll find it a worth investment.

Ah, behold! Your diligence has paid off - you must've had to trek all over Aeternum!\n\nBut now, you enjoy the benefits! Falmea's Wrath! A finer staff has never been crafted! Wield it with pride, {playerName}.
Collect items used to craft the Huntress
Collect items used to craft the Huntress
Collect items used to craft the Huntress
Collect items then craft the Huntress
She hides among the trees. Among the redwoods, she is truly at home.
The resin of the tree perfumes the air. If you're all alone, yet notice that scent, beware.
With eyes like the hawk, she sees for miles. Her vision is clear.
She closes upon her prey, and slowly pulls back. The freedom she feels is like that of an arrow.
Collect items used to craft Falmea's Wrath

Collect items then craft Falmea's Wrath
Falmea burned the Wyrdwood into the air, and left the air hanging with great sorrow.
Falmea let ashes from the Wyrdwood fall. A pure white on the ground, felled.
Falmea revealed her unhallowed water and sprinkled it into the ash.
Falmea spoke the unspeakable and, from a tornado of flame, retrieved a staff.
Handed the recipe.
